discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Salesforce Connect

Explanation:
Salesforce Connect allows external data to be accessed in real-time within Salesforce without storing it directly in the Salesforce database.
Since Cloud Kicks (CK) wants to manage 5 years of case data, storing all of it in Salesforce could lead to storage limitations and performance issues.
Salesforce Connect enables CK to store case data in an external system (e.g., AWS, Azure, or another database) while still making it accessible within Salesforce as an External Object.
Why Not the Other Options?
A. Salesforce CaseHistory Object
The CaseHistory object stores field change tracking for cases but does not help with long-term archiving or external storage.
B. Salesforce Big Object
Big Objects are great for massive amounts of data but do not provide easy, on-demand access for customers

questions.question_text:
Metrics show that Universal Containers has a high call abandonment rate using Service Cloud Voice.

Which strategy should a consultant recommend?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Set up Contact Requests.
Explanation:
Contact Requests allow customers to request a callback instead of waiting on hold, reducing abandonment rates.
This improves customer satisfaction by letting them schedule a call when an agent is available rather than staying in the queue.
Agents can prioritize and handle calls more efficiently, improving overall service levels.

Selected Answer: B
B. Create an IP blocking rule.
Explanation:
IP Blocking Rules allow Cloud Kicks (CK) to prevent specific users from accessing messaging services based on their IP address.
If an abusive customer is identified, CK can block their IP, preventing them from starting new messaging sessions.
This is an effective way to stop repeat offenders while still allowing legitimate customers to engage.
